Class: Camera

goo\renderer/Camera

This class represents a view into a 3d scene and how that view should map to a 2D rendering surface.

new Camera(Number fov, Number aspect, Number near, Number far)

Member summary

<static> Inside

Intersection response from camera.intersect
<static> Intersects

Intersection response from camera.intersect
<static> Outside

Intersection response from camera.intersect
<static> Parallel

Projection mode for parallel/ortographic frustum
<static> Perspective

Projection mode for perspective frustum

Method summary

checkInverseModelView ()

update inverse modelView if necessary.
checkInverseModelViewProjection ()

update inverse modelViewProjection if necessary.
checkModelView ()

update modelView if necessary.
checkModelViewProjection ()

update modelViewProjection if necessary.
checkProjection ()

update projection if necessary.
contains (bound)

Checks a bounding volume against the planes of this camera's frustum and returns if it is completely inside of, outside of, or intersecting.
getFrustumCoordinates (worldPos, store)

Converts a position in world coordinate space to a x,y,z frustum position using the current settings of this camera.
getPickRay (screenX, screenY, screenWidth, screenHeight, store)

Calculate a Pick Ray using the given screen position at the near plane of this camera and the camera's position in space.
removed: param flipVertical if true, we'll flip the screenPosition on the y axis. This is useful when you are dealing with non-opengl coordinate
systems.
getScreenCoordinates (worldPos, screenWidth, screenHeight, store)

Converts a position in world coordinate space to an x,y screen position and depth value using the current settings of this camera.
getWorldCoordinates (screenX, screenY, screenWidth, screenHeight, zDepth, store)

Converts a local x,y screen position and depth value to world coordinates based on the current settings of this camera.
lookAt (Vector3 pos, Vector3 worldUpVector)

A convenience method for auto-setting the frame based on a world position the user desires the camera to look at. It points the camera towards
the given position using the difference between that position and the current camera location as a direction vector and the general
worldUpVector to compute up and left camera vectors.
normalize ()

Ensure our up, left and direction are unit-length vectors.
onFrameChange ()

Updates the values of the world planes associated with this camera.
onFrustumChange ()

Updates internal frustum coefficient values to reflect the current frustum plane values.
pack (sceneBounds)

Compress this camera's near and far frustum planes to be smaller if possible, using the given bounds as a
measure.
setFrame (location, left, up, direction)

Sets the axes and location of the camera. Similar to setAxes, but sets camera
location as well.
setFrustum (near, far, left, right, top, bottom)

Sets the frustum plane values of this camera using the given values.
setFrustumPerspective (fovY, aspect, near, far)

Sets the frustum plane values of this camera using the given perspective values.
setProjectionMode (ProjectionMode projectionMode)

Sets the projection mode of the camera. (Camera.Perspective / Camera.Parallel)
setToObliqueMatrix (clipPlane)

Clipping using oblique frustums
setViewPort (left, right, bottom, top)

Sets the boundaries of this camera's viewport to the given values
update ()

Forces all aspect of the camera to be updated from internal values, and sets all dirty flags to true so that the next apply() call will fully
set this camera to the render context.
updateModelViewMatrix ()

Updates the value of our model view matrix.
updateProjectionMatrix ()

Updates the value of our projection matrix.

Constructor

new Camera(Number fov, Number aspect, Number near, Number far)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
fov Number

the full vertical angle of view, in degrees.
aspect Number

aspect ratio
near Number

near plane distance
far Number

far plane distance

Members

<static> Inside

Intersection response from camera.intersect

<static> Intersects

Intersection response from camera.intersect

<static> Outside

Intersection response from camera.intersect

<static> Parallel

Projection mode for parallel/ortographic frustum

<static> Perspective

Projection mode for perspective frustum

Methods

checkInverseModelView()

update inverse modelView if necessary.

checkInverseModelViewProjection()

update inverse modelViewProjection if necessary.

checkModelView()

update modelView if necessary.

checkModelViewProjection()

update modelViewProjection if necessary.

checkProjection()

update projection if necessary.

contains(bound)

Checks a bounding volume against the planes of this camera's frustum and returns if it is completely inside of, outside of, or intersecting.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
bound

the bound to check for culling
Returns:

intersection type

getFrustumCoordinates(worldPos, store)

Converts a position in world coordinate space to a x,y,z frustum position using the current settings of this camera.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
worldPos

the position in space to retrieve frustum coordinates for.
store

Use to avoid object creation. if not null, the results are stored in the given vector and returned. Otherwise, a new vector is
created.
Returns:

a vector containing the x,y,z frustum position

getPickRay(screenX, screenY, screenWidth, screenHeight, store)

Calculate a Pick Ray using the given screen position at the near plane of this camera and the camera's position in space.
removed: param flipVertical if true, we'll flip the screenPosition on the y axis. This is useful when you are dealing with non-opengl coordinate
systems.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
screenX

the screen x position
screenY

the screen y position
screenWidth

the screen width
screenHeight

the screen height
store

the Ray to store the result in. If false, a new Ray is created and returned.
Returns:

the resulting Ray.

getScreenCoordinates(worldPos, screenWidth, screenHeight, store)

Converts a position in world coordinate space to an x,y screen position and depth value using the current settings of this camera.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
worldPos

the position in space to retrieve screen coordinates for.
screenWidth

the screen width
screenHeight

the screen height
store

Use to avoid object creation. if not null, the results are stored in the given vector and returned. Otherwise, a new vector is
created.
Returns:

a vector containing the screen coordinates as x and y and the distance as a percent between near and far planes.

getWorldCoordinates(screenX, screenY, screenWidth, screenHeight, zDepth, store)

Converts a local x,y screen position and depth value to world coordinates based on the current settings of this camera.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
screenX

the screen x position
screenY

the screen y position
screenWidth

the screen width
screenHeight

the screen height
zDepth

the depth into the camera view to take our point. 0 indicates the near plane of the camera and 1 indicates the far plane.
store

Use to avoid object creation. if not null, the results are stored in the given vector and returned. Otherwise, a new vector is
created.
Returns:

a vector containing the world coordinates.

lookAt(Vector3 pos, Vector3 worldUpVector)

A convenience method for auto-setting the frame based on a world position the user desires the camera to look at. It points the camera towards
the given position using the difference between that position and the current camera location as a direction vector and the general
worldUpVector to compute up and left camera vectors.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
pos Vector3

Where to look at in terms of world coordinates.
worldUpVector Vector3

A normalized vector indicating the up direction of the world. (often Vector3#UNIT_Y or Vector3#UNIT_Z).

normalize()

Ensure our up, left and direction are unit-length vectors.

onFrameChange()

Updates the values of the world planes associated with this camera.

onFrustumChange()

Updates internal frustum coefficient values to reflect the current frustum plane values.

pack(sceneBounds)

Compress this camera's near and far frustum planes to be smaller if possible, using the given bounds as a
measure.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
sceneBounds

the scene bounds

setFrame(location, left, up, direction)

Sets the axes and location of the camera. Similar to setAxes, but sets camera
location as well.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
location
left
up
direction

setFrustum(near, far, left, right, top, bottom)

Sets the frustum plane values of this camera using the given values.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
near
far
left
right
top
bottom

setFrustumPerspective(fovY, aspect, near, far)

Sets the frustum plane values of this camera using the given perspective values.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
fovY

the full angle of view on the Y axis, in degrees.
aspect

the aspect ratio of our view (generally in [0,1]). Often this is canvas width / canvas height.
near

our near plane value
far

our far plane value

setProjectionMode(ProjectionMode projectionMode)

Sets the projection mode of the camera. (Camera.Perspective / Camera.Parallel)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
projectionMode ProjectionMode

The new projection mode - Camera.Perspective or Camera.Parallel

setToObliqueMatrix(clipPlane)

Clipping using oblique frustums

Parameters:
Name Type Description
clipPlane

clipping plane

setViewPort(left, right, bottom, top)

Sets the boundaries of this camera's viewport to the given values

Parameters:
Name Type Description
left
right
bottom
top

update()

Forces all aspect of the camera to be updated from internal values, and sets all dirty flags to true so that the next apply() call will fully
set this camera to the render context.

updateModelViewMatrix()

Updates the value of our model view matrix.

updateProjectionMatrix()

Updates the value of our projection matrix.
